newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy Fin Min studies personal, region tax changes.
newsitem.headline: Italy Fin Min studies personal, region tax changes.

text.p: The Italian finance ministry plans to introduce a new regional tax (Irep) aimed at corporates and self-employed workers as well as an increase in personal tax (Irpef), with money from this going back to the regions.
A source at the ministry said the changes would not alter overall fiscal burden in Italy and would be introduced as part of the 1997 budget package.
"The increase being considered for Irpef is between 0.5 to 1.0 percent," the source said.
"The increase will cover the abolition of health taxation... and will not make any difference to tax revenues," he added.

He said bands for the Irep tax, which will be replacing various taxes due to be scrapped, would be set at between three and five percent of taxable income. "There will be a margin autonomy for the regions to set their own thresholds," he said.
The government has pledged to increase the fiscal power of the regions in a bid to cut the influence of central administration. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
